title: How can an idea just come to you? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ideas are things which have always been there in your mind and have simply lacked the connections being made between them to realise them. An idea can come to you at any point, you could be procrastinating or working and think 'this would make this better' Ideas are formed daily yet not many are acted upon, even the thought of changing something small in your routine is an idea, people have a misconception that an idea is a money making miracle that forms in the mind when in actuality it is mundane and happens constantly, sometimes a idea may be huge but usually the idea was there the whole time just waiting for you to correct the dots with your already well founded knowledge.

How does inspiration strike? In the shower while pondering why you can't do something or get something. In line while wondering if there isn't a better way. While googling for a product or service that is obvious to you but apparently not anyone else. Our best while using someone's flawed product or service saying to yourself I could do better. But that's only 1% of the issue. The other 200% is executing on that idea.

How can an idea come to you? I believe the real question is “How might you generate creative ideas?” That’s the first lesson. Reframe the question. Use the words “How might you…”” That opens your mind to possibilities. More techniques… Look at other industries, arts, issues and notice how they deal with this question. Ask, What would Wonder Woman do? What might Batman do?a What would a farmer in India do? What might Bill Gates do? What might a Martian do?
It comes to you when you give a hard time to something by thinking over it.When it will come is unpredictable so have patience and stay with it.

Teacher appears when the student is ready. Similarly, the idea appears when you are actively looking for the problem and constantly think of solutions. Great ideas then are simply researched better and backed by clear logic.
A combination of daydreaming and having your ears on the ground.
